Definition: In this task, you are given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated with <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases possibly involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words (e.g., PersonX, PersonY, PersonZ). PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether the Head includes an event or an action in the Tail or not. This happens when the Tail denotes a step within the larger head event. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No".
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Physical Commonsense
Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: Head: have conversation<sep>Tail: choose subject to discuss
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. The Head includes the event of choosing a subject the Tail.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX allergic to bees<sep>Tail: none
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, there isn't any action or event in the Tail. So the output should be"No".
In this example, designing software includes checking the design. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX asks to go home<sep>Tail: to go rest
Negative Examples.explanation: Asking to go home doesn't include going rest. So the output should be "No".
The communicate includes gathering the thoughts, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: play harp<sep>Tail: put down harp
Head: PersonX also loved ___<sep>Tail: to find something they enjoy
Head: PersonX asks PersonX's grandma<sep>Tail: good.
Head: start family<sep>Tail: watch grow old
Head: win baseball game<sep>Tail: start game
Head: have asthma attack<sep>Tail: have difficulty breathing
Head: PersonX becomes fast ___<sep>Tail: to be social
